title: Brand Ambassador
description:
**Wine & Spirits Brand Ambassadors/Tasting Reps Needed Nationally (Part-Time)**

**Overview:**

Latitude Beverage, one of the fastest growing wine and spirits companies in the US, is looking for new brand ambassadors/tasting reps to help support our portfolio of brands at events and tastings in key markets nationwide. Our brands include 90+ Cellars, Iron Side, Mija Sangria, Tequila Zarpado, Wheel Horse Whiskey and more!

We are currently looking for ambassadors in the following markets:

Bronx, NY

**Summary:**

The ideal Brand Ambassador candidate should have a base knowledge of, and/or a passion for wine and spirits. They will ideally have some experience sampling products (food, beverage, alcohol, or other) in retail environments or at events, and should be very comfortable talking to people in a public setting. In this role, you will conduct tastings primarily at retail locations (wine & spirits stores, grocery stores, etc) and possibly some events. We are looking for reliable and outgoing candidates who have a desire to learn about our products and build brand awareness.

**Responsibilities:** 

Working directly with a Latitude Sales Rep, you will be presented with event opportunities on an ongoing basis. Number of events/hours will vary per market and per season. In some cases there may be upwards of 3-4 events opportunities per week.

As a part-time Brand Ambassador for Latitude, you will:

* Conduct 2-3 hour in-store tastings of our wine and spirits products
* Coordinate your tasting schedule with a local sale rep/manager
* Stay informed about our wine and spirits portfolio to effectively communicate product information to consumers.
* Provide superior customer service as a face and voice of Latitude Beverage via in-person interactions.

* Must be available to work weekends/ have a flexible schedule
* Organized and detail oriented
* Excellent people skills
* Motivated to work independently and able to work in a professional manner

title: Medical Assistant (Clinical) (Monday to Friday) (Day Shift) - Bronx
description:
AdvantageCare Physicians (ACPNY) is a primary and specialty care practice serving half a million patients across the New York metropolitan area. With more than 35 medical offices across New York City and Long Island, ACPNY is continually expanding our practice and enhancing our services for communities throughout New York. As we grow, our employees grow with us.

We’re bringing together an amazing Care Team to work with our patients in the Bronx. As a member of this team, you would help us in delivering “whole you” care, which recognizes the physical, mental, and lifestyle factors that impact a patient’s health.

We are proud that our workforce is as diverse as the communities we serve, and we are intentional about our inclusive practices for our organization. This commitment drives our unyielding desire to deliver high-quality care and community-focused collaborations. By integrating these behaviors into our day-to-day operations, ACPNY strives to create healthier futures for our patients.

To do this, we need an exceptional group of physicians, nurses, and support staff.

**Job Summary**

We are seeking Medical Assistants (Care Team Associates II) to join us

**The ideal candidate should have:**

* Work experience as a Medical Assistant
* Patient-centered approach toward a positive patient experience
* Excellent communication skills

**Responsibilities:**

Medical Assistant (Care Team Associate II) serves as a member of the Care Team in the treatment and care of patients who assists providers with clinical services and administrative tasks to support population health guided best in class care. The position works under the supervision of the Practice Administrator and in collaboration with the Nurse Manager. The Medical Assistant (Care Team Associate II) must understand basic medical terminology, demonstrate customer service excellence, have the ability to recognize data reflective of the patient’s status and inform the Registered Nurse/Licensed Practical Nurse of his/her observations.

**Qualifications:**

* High School diploma or GED required
* Certificate of completion from an accredited Medical Assistant Program required **or** eligibility to sit for the national certification exam and pass the exam within 18 months of hire required
* Minimum 1 year experience as medical assistant in an ambulatory care setting
* Experience and ability to navigate an EMR required
* Associate degree preferred
* Preferred 3 years’ experience as medical assistant in an ambulatory care setting preferred

**Medical Office Hours of Operation**

* Monday-Thursday 8:00AM – 6:00PM
* Friday 8:00AM – 5:00PM

**Why work at AdvantageCare Physicians?**

ACPNY’s vision is to become a home for health that provides personal, effective, and convenient care for the neighborhoods and communities we serve. When our teams of providers, nurses, and specialists work together, we can get patients in sooner, answer their questions in real time, and give them the support they need to achieve their health goals. Everything we do is guided by our values:

**Empower** — We believe in acting as proactive self-starters and enabling our colleagues to succeed.

**Deliver** — We believe in achieving our goals and taking accountability for our actions.

**Do It Together** — We believe in caring for our customers, patients, and one another, while valuing diversity, equity, and inclusion.

Encouraging growth and development is an important part of the employee experience at ACPNY. We empower employees to develop both personally and professionally through a variety of programs, including internal collaborative learning opportunities where team members share stories from their own lives, discuss research, and ultimately learn from each other.

We believe diversity, equity, and inclusion are fundamental to creating a strong workplace and community.

**Pay Disclosure:**

A good faith estimate of the compensation range for individuals hired to work for the EmblemHealth Family of Companies is provided. This compensation range is specific and considers factors such as (but not limited to) the scope and responsibilities of the position, the candidate’s work experience, education/training, internal peer equity, and market and business considerations. The disclosed range estimate has not been adjusted for the applicable geographic differential associated with the location at which the work is being performed. It is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range, as compensation decisions depend on each case’s facts and circumstances. Union roles covered by a collective bargaining agreement will compensate in accordance with the union contract.

title: Claims Trainee
description:
The Claims Associate will investigate commercial insurance automobile, cargo and general liability claims. Claims will be handled from the initial loss report through final disposition.
Key Responsibilities:* Investigation of policy coverage and liability with a detailed analysis of applicable state laws; damage determination for property, commodity, and personal injury claims.
* Responsibilities also include establishing a course of action to conclude claims timely and in compliance with state regulatory requirements. Exposures are to be analyzed and proper reserves established. Escalation of high exposure claims is to be made to management for direction.
* Task assignments to outside vendors are required along with oversight and management of the vendor.
* Communication to policyholders, agents, and underwriting on key claim issues is required. Conduct open claim reviews and work cohesively with other departments to deliver superior customer service and claim service to policyholders.
* Travel may be required to attend training activities.


Experience* Prior Insurance experience is not required, but strong analytical skills are required to effectively and efficiently analyze information.
* Must possess excellent verbal and written communication skills to express complex evaluations and resolve claims through a well-planned negotiation strategy.
* Customer service skills and a willingness to work in a team-oriented environment are essential.


The expected pay range for the role is $27/hour (35 hours per week). The specific offer will depend on an applicant’s skills and experiences. The disclosed pay range estimate may also be adjusted for the applicable geographic differential for the location in which the position is filled.  

  

Applicants must be authorized to work for any employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa for this position.

title: Outreach Liaison
description:
**Company Overview:** At Essen Health Care, we care for that!

As the largest privately held multispecialty medical group in the Bronx, we provide high-quality, compassionate, and accessible medical care to some of the most vulnerable and under-served residents of New York State. Guided by a Population Health model of care, Essen has five integrated clinical divisions offering urgent care, primary care, and specialty services, as well as nursing home staffing and care management. Founded in 1999, our over 20-year commitment has fueled an unwavering dedication toward innovating a better healthcare delivery system. Essen has expanded from a single primary care office to an umbrella organization offering specialties from women’s health to endocrinology, from psychiatry to a vast array of other specialties. All clinical services are offered via telehealth or in-person at over 35 medical offices and at home through the Essen House Calls program.

Essen Health Care is the place Where Care Comes Together! We are looking for the most talented and effective individuals to join our rapidly growing company. With over 1,100 employees and 400+ Practitioners, we care for over 250,000 patients annually in New York City and beyond. From medical providers to administration & operational staff, there is a career here for you. Join our team today!

Overview

**The Community Outreach Liaison represents Essen Health Care’s Urgent Care Division by generating new business and strengthening referral sources. They are responsible for building and maintaining positive relationships with community agencies, nonprofits, organizations, employers, physicians and other providers of care who refer and/or could refer patients to our business.**

Job Summary

The primary goal of the Community Outreach Liaison is to establish and generate referrals, generate awareness of our company and services, and anticipate, identify, and resolve service issues, while facilitating and improving internal/external communications.

* Liaison will also track and analyze existing referral patterns and reports trends to management. Supports the department by participating in various health fairs, seminars or educational events, or other projects, to enhance a positive image for the company.
* Candidate will be equally responsible for establishing a high level of customer service by facilitating referrals, providing information on new programs and services, and the introduction of new providers/services.
* Candidate will provide timely resolutions to issues that impact referral operations and will be charged to communicate outcomes in a timely fashion. Interacts with Executive Manager and other staff to relay referral source concerns, and recommend and/or assist in the resolution of problems or service issues.

Responsibilities

**Responsibilities**

Conduct effective outreach and referral cultivation visits.

Effectively manage territories assigned

Coordinate meetings between key providers and staff to improve communication and relationships

Cultivate targeted referral sources to meet daily/monthly goals

Participate at Community/ Employer Health Fairs, community outreach events and

Educational presentations (churches/synagogues, etc.)

Maintain, update and refine our sales database for all offices, referring sources and

Staff/ office contacts.

Run timely reports to accurately track referral sources activity.

Assist Marketing Department with outreach related projects

**Competencies**  
Communication Proficiency

**Work Environment**  
Heavy travel throughout the community;

**Position Type/Expected Hours of Work**  
this is a full-time position. Days and hours of work are Monday through Friday, 9:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

**Travel**

Heavy travel is expected for this position

Qualifications

**Required Education and Experience**  
**Qualifications & Skills**

Track record of exceeding activity and sales goals preferred.

Healthcare background a plus.

Problem solving and customer service skills required.

Must be highly professional in appearance, tone and delivery and an effective communicator.

Dedicated to follow-thru and results.

Flexibility as it relates to schedule, responsibilities and priorities

Knowledge of healthcare and direct marketing to community agencies and/or physicians preferable.

Sales/marketing specific background or education with focus on consultative selling.

The ability to interact with, support, and positively influence the behavior and activities of referral sources, superiors and staff/co-employees.

Must be an exceptional listener, with the proven ability to problem-solve to issues discussed.

Strong organizational and speaking/presenting skills.

The ability to work independently and in a group setting, high integrity, reasoned and thoughtful judgment, a sense of urgency and analytical and intuitive skills.

Knowledge of preparing, and interpreting spreadsheets and reports, and data analysis.

Proficiency in Word, Excel, and Power Point.

Equal Opportunity Employer

**ESSEN HEALTH CARE IS PROUD TO BE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER**

Essen Healthcare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer, and we seek candidates who desire to work in and serve an ethnically-diverse population.

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $19.00 - $21.00 per hour

Work Location: In person

title: Assistant Manager
description:
Safeguard Self Storage is a leader in the storage industry. We have been developing quality storage properties across the U.S. since 1989. Safeguard's modern facilities are located right in the communities where our customers live. We design every Safeguard with the character of the surrounding neighborhood in mind. We work with the business community and local government, as well as the general public, to create facilities that everyone is proud to have in their community. We offer our customers a state of the art facility with high-tech security and climate control. We also provide our customers storage advice (how to estimate the amount of space needed and how to pack a storage unit effectively), materials for moving and storing possessions such as boxes, pads, dollies, etc., moving and packing tips and will accept commercial deliveries without the customer being present.

Currently, we are seeking a Assistant Manager to join our team of professionals to assist at our facilities in Nassau County.

Job summary: As a Assistant Manager you will report to Facility Managers and the District Manager and are responsible for overseeing the operations of the Safeguard store in the absence of a Store Manager. This position is accountable for direct customer sales as well as follow-up with the customers referred to the store by the Call-Center.

Responsibilities:

* Respond to customer issues and concerns in a timely manner.
* Provide potential customers with information about the variety of available storage spaces and amenities.
* Meet and maintain monthly revenue goals.
* Audit daily documents and process approved invoices.
* Contact delinquent customers to request payment.
* Perform security functions.
* Reconcile tenant inventory.
* Maintain and ensure all areas are clean and free of any maintenance issues.
* Conduct merchandise inventory counts to ensure an ample supply is available and enter merchandise into the computer system.

Qualifications / Skills

* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Preferred 2+ years experience in storage or sales.
* Previous sales, hospitality, retail or business management experience a plus.
* Microsoft applications Word, Excel a plus.
* Bi-lingual (English and Spanish) highly desired not required.
* Must be able to work weekends however we offer a good work / life style balance - 40 hours a week with no late evening shifts.

We offer an excellent compensation package to our Assistant Managers to include:

* WORK LIFE BALANCE. No late evening shifts.
* Quarterly performance bonus
* Medical, dental, vision, life and disability insurance.
* 401(k) plan with company match.
* Paid vacations and holidays.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and value diversity at Safeguard Self Storage. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.50 - $19.50 per hour

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Flexible schedule
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Referral program
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 10 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Holidays
* Weekends as needed

* Bonus opportunities

title: Operations Center Operator 1
description:
To provide first rate customer service support to the public on the trains and in the stations, through real time operation of the Automatic Train Control (ATC), power distribution and communications systems. This position is responsible for the day-to-day support of customer service through effective communications, maintenance of balanced headway’s, buildups and reductions; effective utilization of emergency and failure management strategies; support of maintenance through efficient implementation of the Work Authorization Procedures and clearances; and any other support which affects or could affect customer service.


**Hourly rate: $28.84**

  


**To provide first rate customer service support to the public on the trains and in the stations, through real time operation of the Automatic Train Control (ATC), power distribution and communications systems. This position is responsible for the day to day support of customer service through effective communications, maintenance of balanced headway’s, buildups and reductions; effective utilization of emergency and failure management strategies; support of maintenance through efficient implementation of the Work Authorization Procedures and clearances; and any other support which affects or could affect customer service.**

  


**Duties and Responsibilities:**


* Through effective communication provides accurate information to all customers, support personnel and emergency services regarding all aspects of customer service, emergencies or critical events and special conditions which may exist throughout the AirTrain system.
* Support all revenue activities in accordance with the applicable service plan, to include: service levels, radio communications, monitoring applicable CCTV systems, spare train utilization, troubleshooting, testing and any other functions which affect or could affect the delivery of customer service.
* Through interaction with ATC, SCADA and communication systems, implements and/or coordinates contingency plans to include the necessary strategies as defined by the supervisor during service disruptions and emergencies to minimize delays and inconvenience to the customer.
* Through interaction with the ATC system, manages the assembly of rail vehicle consists and ensures that the scheduled trains are correctly configured and available for movement into customer service.
* Is responsible for the power configuration through interaction with the SCADA system for normal service, or maintenance and emergencies activities.
* Implements and/or coordinates the safe and efficient execution of work ATP through use of areas, work permits, occupancy permits and clearances in accordance with existing rules and procedures.
* Maintains accurate and complete documentation of all activities on the AirTrain system as identified in the Operations Center manual. Through use of shift logbooks
* Takes part in training, re-training and examinations as required by the Operations Center qualification program.
* Works within defined policies and procedures regarding both in normal and emergency operations
* Through interaction with the communications and CCTV systems, monitors platforms, stations, intrusion alarms, customer activity and any other system which affects customer service.
* Maybe required to perform coverage for short term supervisor vacancy.
* Works variable hours and shifts. Performs other related duties as required.

  




**Note:**


This job description should not be construed to imply that these requirements are the only duties, responsibilities, and qualifications for this job. Incumbents may be required to follow any additional related instructions, acquire related job skills, and perform other related work as operational requirements demand.

  


**Minimum Qualifications:**


* Ability to communicate effectively, both orally and in writing; ability to maintain a rapport with employees and other personnel and the ability to deal courteously and effectively with others.
* Ability to exercise prudent and timely judgement in normal and emergency situations; thoroughly evaluate facts to follow through and effectively document actions taken.
* Ability to troubleshoot on defective station equipment and perform minor adjustments to restore operations.
* Willingness to undergo training in AirTrain Operations rules, regulations, policies and procedures, as they pertain to Field Operations. Ability to maintain certifications required to perform control center functions.
* 10-year background check for Non-Aeronautical Operations Area ID Card (Non-AOA ID Card)
* Work Keys Aptitude Test.

  




**Education – Experience:**


* An associate degree from an accredited college or university in a customer service field with completion of management courses preferred. Two years of supervisory experience in a related field preferred.
* A combination of education and experience may be acceptable.


We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those under consideration will be contacted.

  


An agile, inclusive and responsible culture is the foundation of our company where diverse people are offered excellent opportunities to grow, learn and advance in their careers. We are committed to encouraging our employees to reach their full potential, while valuing and respecting them as individuals.

  


Alstom is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, disability status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by Federal, National, or Local Laws.

  


*Effective 29 January 2021, Alstom completed the acquisition of Bombardier Transportation. This is a Bombardier Transportation Legal Entity Position - positions at Bombardier Transportation companies are all members of the Alstom Group***.**

  

  

**Nearest Major Market:** Queens
  

**Nearest Secondary Market:** New York City
  

**Job Segment:** Operations Manager, Operations

title: Full-Time Administrative Assistant
description:
**The Family Center (TFC)** is a nonprofit providing behavioral and mental health services, as well as social and legal services, to families affected by illness, crisis and loss. The Family Center has pioneered programming design and research to address the myriad of issues that challenge vulnerable New Yorkers and their families. Please visit our website at www.thefamilycenter.org to learn more.

The Family Center’s is looking for a **Full-Time Administrative Assistant,** who will provide administrative support to the Behavioral Health Services department. They will report to the Deputy Executive Director of Behavioral Health and Support Services.

**Primary Responsibilities**

* Greet all clients in a friendly and professional manner. Handle check-in procedures and client registration

•Translate behavioral health services provided into codes that can be reimbursed by payers

•Transmit coded client treatment information to outsourced fiscal company and other recipients

•Check client insurance coverage with insurance company and verifying client eligibility for services

•Communicate with insurance companies, clients and outsourced fiscal company to assist with resolving any billing issues

•Handle confidential information, including client records, with a high degree of integrity and adhering to all HIPAA and confidentiality policies and practices

•Participate in all mandatory trainings and attend in-service training as required

•Assist with administrative reviews and audits as necessary

•Answer all calls and route as necessary

•Perform receptionist, clerical and administrative duties as required

•Book, coordinate, and prepare rooms for consultations and meetings, and maintain calendars

•Handle mail and deliveries, which includes going to the post office and other mailing centers

•Keep waiting areas and front offices clean and presentable

•Open and close the building as needed

•Data entry

•Work at the third-floor reception area as needed, which may include additional operations or administrative duties

•Other duties as assigned

**Required Qualifications**

•High School Diploma or GED

•At least 2 years of receptionist, administrative or similar experience

•Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to communicate clearly

•Superb attention to detail, including the ability to catch and fix errors

•Solid computer skills, especially Excel

•Flexible and a team player

•Excellent judgment and problem solving skills

•Self-motivated and self-directed

•Ability to prioritize tasks and responsibilities and complete duties in the allotted time

•Must be able to remain stationed at a desk for long periods of time and occasionally lift up to 25 pounds

**Desired Qualifications**

* Associate’s Degree

•Fluency or proficiency in Spanish

•Familiarity with CPT and ICD-10 codes for Mental and Behavioral Health services

**Location:** This position is fully on-site and is not eligible for remote work. Our office is located at 493 Nostrand Avenue, Brooklyn, NY, which is conveniently located steps away from several public transportation options.

**Starting Pay Range:** $40,000.00-$45,000.00 per year

**Schedule:** Full-time, 35 hours per week.Must be available for flexible scheduling. Work hours may range from 8am-7pm. Must be available to work occasional weekends as needed

**Employee Benefits:** The Family Center offers a highly competitive benefits package, which includes medical, dental and vision insurance, Long-Term Disability insurance, a 403(b) retirement plan, a pension plan, a Flexible Spending Account (FSA), Life Insurance, commuter benefits, a tuition reimbursement program, paid federal holidays, summer Fridays and other early leave days throughout the year, a generous vacation policy, and extensive professional training and development opportunities.

The Family Center is a registered 501(c)(3) nonprofit, and is an eligible employer for the Public Service Loan Forgiveness Program.

At The Family Center, we are dedicated to creating a positive work environment for our team. We value relationship-building and collaboration within and across its departments. We also greatly value and appreciate our team members, their well-being and work-life integration. We strive to create a workplace where staff feel supported and receive ongoing coaching, training and opportunities for growth. The Family Center is also committed to diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) and has a DEI program that all team members have the opportunity to participate in and contribute to.

**How to Apply**

Please email your resume and cover letter to jobs@thefamilycenter.org and put “BH Administrative Assistant” in the subject line. In your cover letter, please include where you found this job posting. Applications will be accepted on a rolling basis. Applications submitted without a cover letter will not be considered.

The Family Center appreciates the time that candidates put into their applications, and carefully reviews each one. Due to a high volume of applicants, however, the Family Center is only able to contact those candidates that are selected for further consideration.

**Equal Opportunity** 

The Family Center is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

title: Architectural Drafter (AutoCad) | 3+ Years NYC Commercial Experience
description:
**Architectural (AUTOCad) Drafter** 

**Azarkian Architecture P.C. (AAPC) is seeking an Architectural Drafter to join our team.** 

**THE COMPANY:** 

AAPC is a zoning and compliance-focused architectural firm based in New York City that provides compliance architecture solutions for commercial spaces and properties, closely following NYC Department of Buildings and other city agencies to navigate regulations with precision. We offer a comprehensive range of services, including zoning & code determinations, space planning & design, construction documents and site inspections.

**RESPONSIBILITIES:** 

* **Drafting & Design:** Create detailed technical drawings using AutoCAD, including plans, elevations, sections
* **Revisions:** Update and refine existing drawings to reflect changes in design, specifications, or project requirements
* **Team Collaboration:** Work closely with project managers, and production staff to ensure drawings meet project specifications and quality standards
* **Collaborate** with in-house architects and expeditors to develop comprehensive architectural drawing sets that adhere to NYC agency standards and regulations.
* **Maintain accurate** and u**p-to-date** project documentation.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Degree in Architecture
* 2+ years work experience with NYC Building Code + Zoning Regulations
* Previous experience working on commercial and hospitality projects
* Ability to interpret and work from technical drawings and specifications
* Experienced AutoCAD user
* Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite
* Highly organized with an attention to detail
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative, and dynamic environment

title: FIELD SERVICE SUPERVISOR - SPRINKLER
company: TFP1 Inc dba Total Fire Protection Inc
description:
At Total Fire Protection, our **MISSION** is simple, **“Embracing Relationships, while keeping you safe, and delivering First Class Service.”** You won’t just be a team member at Total Fire Protection, but a valuable contributor. Our diverse team members support one another as we work towards our common goal of bringing Fire and Life Safety to our customers nationwide.

  

Our Company culture has been built on the foundation of our **CORE VALUES** that define **“Who We Are”** and we hold each other accountable to these **CORE VALUES.** Our ***Five-Alarm Growth*** represents our commitment to embracing change, evolutionary action, continuous learning, constant improvement and full engagement. We place the priorities of our ***Team First*** and our team members back it up through ***Do What You Say!*** execution. Total Fire Protection believes that ***Do the Right Thing!*** builds loyalty, trust and respect because ***We Care*** about our team members, our customers and our community.

  

Every team member brings their own expertise to Total Fire Protection and is encouraged to make their voice heard. We offer a family-oriented culture of teamwork and encourage continuous learning, a diverse atmosphere, and opportunities for career advancement.

  

 Total Fire Protection is expanding rapidly, presenting an exciting and challenging opportunity to bring your fresh ideas, polished expertise, and collaborative attitude to support our growth. The **Field Service Supervisor** will work directly with our customer facing service team both in the field and in the office. As the **Field Service Supervisor**, you will report directly to the **Service Manager**. The **Field Service Supervisor** is a front-line management position with direct supervisory and leadership accountability. We will train the right candidate.

  

As a Field Service Supervisor, you will be directly responsible for the following:

 **Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Live Our Values!
* Understand Total Fire Protection’s strategy, business and growth initiatives
* Assist in the hiring, training, developing, and evaluating of the Field Service team to ensure Total Fire Protection customers receive the highest level of service in the most effective and efficient manner.
* Drive a company-owned vehicle to and from Customer sites and assisting the Service team with servicing of customer accounts.
* Overseeing several key service department areas including, but not limited to, maintaining excellent customer relationships, increasing internal sales, maintaining an efficient route structure, and ensuring driver compliance.
* Ensure that all Field Service Technicians obtain required licensing and certifications to perform the required services offered by Total Fire Protection.
* Administrative duties including, but not limited to, overseeing and execution of performance metrics of the Field Service Team.
* Maintains and organizes truck inventory and all field-testing equipment.
* Must adhere to company safety policies and procedures.
* Must have a strong work ethic.
* Must be detail-oriented, strong written and verbal communication skills.
* Other responsibilities and tasks, as assigned by the Field Service Manager and/or Service Operations Management.

 **Required Skills and Experience**

* FDNY S-12/13/14 COF & Jurisdictional Required COFs preferred.
* NICET Certification – Inspection and Testing of Water-Based Systems (preferred)
* Must have 5+ years of experience inspecting and servicing various sprinkler systems.
* Supervise a team of fire sprinkler field technicians, providing guidance and support to ensure efficient and high-quality work.
* Strong leadership skills to lead team of inspectors and mechanics in larger environments on extensive inspections and repairs.
* Provide technical support and training to technicians to ensure their ongoing professional development.
* Monitor and evaluate the quality of work performed by technicians to ensure adherence to company standards, local regulations, and best practices.
* Communicate with clients, building managers, and fire department officials regarding fire sprinkler system status, inspection results, and any necessary repairs or upgrades.
* Facilitate and support the coordination of field resources with the Logistics Coordinators and Service Manager.
* Required to have a full understanding of NFPA 25 and local AHJ compliance regulations.
* Proficiency with various types of sprinkler systems including but not limited to: Wet Pipe, Dry Pipe, Pre-Action, Deluge, Foam
* Must be proficient in the use and application of mobile app devices utilized for scheduling, payroll, and inspection reporting.
* Identify opportunities for process improvements and develop strategies to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of field operations.
* Keen assessment and competence in deficiency impairment identification and remedy.
* Possesses mechanical skills to perform service repairs
* Stay up to date on local fire codes, NFPA standards, and other relevant regulations, ensuring that all work performed meets the necessary requirements.
* Must have a valid driver’s license with a clean record and be able to clear a drug screening upon request.
* Must perform on-call service duties as assigned.

 **Physical Requirements**

* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to:
* Work in unusual and sometimes difficult positions/circumstances such as with ladders, scaffolding, high lift equipment, wires, ducts, crawl spaces, attics, above ceilings, etc.
* Lift, move, and hold up to approximately 50 lbs.
* Must be able to work a full-time, flexible schedule with “on call availability” and must be able to travel on short notice.
* Must be able to drive a motor vehicle (day and evenings) for extended time periods.
* Commitment to maintaining a safe working environment and adhering to safety protocols

  

Think you have what it takes to be a Total Fire Protection team member? Apply to be a part of this dynamic organization!

  

Total Fire Protection is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any applicant on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, gender, marital status, age, disability, sexual orientation, military/veteran status, or any other status protected by Federal or State law or local ordinance.

title: Field Service Technician
company: TFP1 Inc dba Total Fire Protection Inc
description:
At Total Fire Protection, our **MISSION** is simple, **“Embracing Relationships, while keeping you safe, and delivering First Class Service.”** You won’t just be a team member at Total Fire Protection, but a valuable contributor. Our diverse team members support one another as we work towards our common goal of bringing Fire and Life Safety to our customers nationwide.

  

Our Company culture has been built on the foundation of our **CORE VALUES** that define **“Who We Are”** and we hold each other accountable to these **CORE VALUES.** Our ***Five-Alarm Growth*** represents our commitment to embracing change, evolutionary action, continuous learning, constant improvement and full engagement. We place the priorities of our ***Team First*** and our team members back it up through ***Do What You Say!*** execution. Total Fire Protection believes that ***Do the Right Thing!*** builds loyalty, trust and respect because ***We Care*** about our team members, our customers and our community.

  

As a Field Service Technician specializing in fire extinguisher service, you will be responsible for providing maintenance, inspection, and repair services for fire extinguishers representing Total Fire Protection. Your primary goal will be to ensure that fire extinguishers are in proper working condition and compliant with relevant safety regulations. This position requires a strong knowledge of fire extinguisher types, components, and servicing procedures.

 **Responsibilities:**

  

* Perform routine inspections of fire extinguishers according to established schedules and standards.
* Conduct thorough examinations of extinguishers to identify any defects, damages, or signs of wear.
* Maintain accurate records of inspections, testing, and maintenance activities for each extinguisher.
* Conduct servicing and recharging of fire extinguishers to ensure they are fully functional and ready for use.
* Ensure that all serviced fire extinguishers meet relevant fire codes, regulations, and standards.
* Update and maintain accurate records of services provided, including dates, details, and any necessary corrective actions.
* Communicate inspection findings and recommendations to clients or internal stakeholders.
* Interact professionally and courteously with clients while on-site, addressing any questions or concerns.
* Provide knowledgeable advice and guidance regarding fire extinguisher maintenance, usage, and safety practices.
* Collaborate with internal teams, such as sales or customer support, to coordinate service requests and resolve issues.
* Stay up to date with industry standards, regulations, and best practices related to fire extinguisher servicing.
* Attend training sessions and workshops to enhance technical skills and knowledge.
* Share expertise and knowledge with colleagues to contribute to a culture of continuous learning.

  

Requirements:

  

* Valid driver's license and clean driving record.
* High school diploma or equivalent; additional technical certifications or training in fire safety is preferred.
* Proven experience as a field service technician or in a similar role, preferably within the fire and life safety industry.
* Solid understanding of different fire extinguisher types, their components, and servicing requirements.
* Familiarity with relevant safety codes, regulations, and standards (e.g., NFPA, OSHA).
* Strong mechanical and troubleshooting skills to diagnose and resolve equipment issues.
* Excellent organizational and time management skills to handle multiple service calls efficiently.
* Effective communication skills, both verbal and written, to interact with clients and internal teams.
* Physical fitness and the ability to lift and carry heavy equipment when necessary.
* Commitment to maintaining a safe working environment and adhering to safety protocols.

  

Think you have what it takes to be a Total Fire Protection team member? Apply to be a part of this dynamic organization!

title: Courier- Eurofins Environment Testing, Elmsford, NY
description:
**Job Overview**

Eurofins Environment Testing is searching for a Courier in Elmsford, NY. Position is full-time, Monday-Friday, 10 a.m.-6:30 p.m., with overtime as needed. Candidates currently living within a commutable distance of Elmsford, NY are encouraged to apply.

**Please apply directly on our career page here https://smrtr.io/nkLB5 for faster consideration.**

\\*\\*Must be comfortable with driving in the NYC area.

The Courier is responsible for the pick-up and delivery of water, soil and air samples to and from the laboratory. Maintain the quality, hold time, and turnaround time objectives of the lab. Prepare and deliver bottle orders to clients following the SOP of the lab. Receive and stock all sample control supplies, prepare and ship sample kits and perform sampling events as needed. Dispose of samples and hazardous waste according to guidelines and carry out any other duties assigned by the department manager.

**Courier responsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following:**

· Perform all duties as outlined in the SOP for Couriers.

· Pick up and deliver samples, bottle orders and report to the laboratory for sign-in and analysis.

· Count the number of samples when receiving them from clients to make sure that the Chain of Custody and samples match. Verify that samples are not broken or damaged.

· Receive and sign the Chain of Custody.

· Ensure that client signs, dates, and records time on the Chain of Custody when releasing samples.

· Transport samples on ice from client site to the lab, or from our lab to a sub- contracted laboratory.

· Unload samples and inspect for damage or violated hold times to maintain sample integrity.

· Interact with Project Managers and clients appropriately and professionally.

· Follow directions or use maps to locate client offices/sites as specified in the courier request form.

· Communicate effectively with the courier coordinator about the courier schedule.

· Record in the courier log book the time that courier arrives to the site and time leaving from the site for all the pick ups and deliveries.

· Maintain records for the vehicle maintenance and driving miles; turn it in at the end of each month.

· Restock supplies when received so supplies are available to employees when needed.

· Verify the validity and completeness of all bottle orders being delivered. This verification is done prior to leaving for delivery.

· Perform duties in accordance with Section 14 of the Transportation and Fleet Safety of the Corporate Safety Manual.

· Comply with the Company’s “Driver Evaluation and Qualification Policy”.

· Maintain the shipping/receiving area to ensure a safe work environment.

· Prepare outgoing shipments of bottle kits and coolers for pick-up.

· Perform on-site sampling events as needed.

· Dispose of samples according to guidelines on a monthly basis to remain in compliance with EPA and EH&S requirements.

· Maintain delivery truck to keep in proper working order.

· Label samples after log in on an as needed basis.

· May be assigned other sample control duties as identified by the department manager of Sample Control.

**The ideal candidate would possess:**

· Ability to read maps and follow directions

· Ability to operate a motor vehicle

· Ability to prioritize

· Excellent communication (oral and written) and attention to detail

· Ability to work independently and as part of a team, self-motivation, adaptability, and a positive attitude

· Ability to learn new techniques, perform multiple tasks simultaneously, keep accurate records, follow instructions, and comply with company policies

**Basic Minimum Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or equivalent
* Authorization to work in the United States indefinitely without restriction or sponsorship
* Must be able to pass a preemployment background check and drug screen
* Must have a valid US drivers license without recent incident. Driving record history will checked on final candidate.
* Must be able to lift 50lbs

**Compensation:$17.50/hour** 

Company Description

Eurofins Scientific is an international life sciences company, providing a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries, to make life and our environment safer, healthier and more sustainable. From the food you eat, to the water you drink, to the medicines you rely on, Eurofins laboratories work with the biggest companies in the world to ensure the products they supply are safe, their ingredients are authentic, and labelling is accurate.

Eurofins is dedicated to delivering testing services that contribute to the health and safety of society and the planet, and to its corporate responsibility to protect the environment and ensure diversity, equity, and inclusion across the entire network of Eurofins companies.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $17.50 per hour

Expected hours: 35 – 45 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Company car
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Paid training
* Referral program
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Shift:

* Day shift

Work Days:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person
company_description: Eurofins Scientific is a group of international life sciences companies which provide a unique range of analytical testing services to clients across multiple industries.

title: Customer Care Advocate
description:
Are you passionate about immigration law and dedicated to providing exceptional care to clients? Do you thrive on helping others achieve their dreams and find joy in their gratitude for your work? If you excel at communicating with clients, understanding their needs, and ensuring a seamless immigration journey, then we have the perfect role for you. Join our dynamic team in New York, NY, and play a vital part in guiding clients through the complexities of the immigration process as a Scheduling and Client Intake Specialist. Your primary responsibilities will include warmly welcoming clients, building trust through informed responses about immigration law, and fostering a spirit of collaboration and support. Every interaction with a client is an opportunity to showcase our commitment to quality, outstanding service, and expertise. Your ability to articulate the company's values, services, and knowledge will be key in attracting and retaining clients. As the ideal candidate, you will be instrumental in encouraging clients to schedule consultations and ensuring they have a positive experience from their initial contact with the firm to their consultation session. Your role will involve handling client inquiries, coordinating consultations based on visa eligibility, managing the intake process, collecting necessary information and documentation, preparing attorneys with relevant client details, and providing compassionate support throughout the client journey.

 **Compensation:**

* Salary range: $60,000 - $70,000 depending on experience
* Paid Time Off
* Health Benefits after 90 days
* Eventual 401k Matching

  

Please provide 2-3 paragraphs telling us why you believe you’re the right candidate for this role in the cover letter screening question that will be emailed to you. Why do we need to meet you? What can you do that someone else can’t, makes you different or stand out? In short, why are you the best choice?

**Compensation:**
$60,000 - $70,000 yearly DOE

**Responsibilities:*** Manage the client pipeline by handling incoming inquiries and persuading clients to enroll in services.
* Schedule client consultations and meetings with attorneys using the Clio Case Management System.
* Take charge of the intake process, developing systems to streamline procedures and maximize the capabilities of the Clio case management platform.
* Understand clients' immigration needs, identify required assistance, and gather essential information through qualifying questions.
* Coordinate the schedules of two attorneys, ensuring they are well-prepared for client consultations.
* Update clients, attorneys, and calendars with any changes to consultation schedules.
* Collaborate closely with attorneys and paralegals to respond promptly to client inquiries.
* Conduct thorough intake interviews to collect necessary information and documentation for immigration consultations.
* Provide attorneys with client summaries before consultations to facilitate effective engagement.
* Enter client data into case management systems in preparation for consultations.
* Offer empathetic support and guidance to clients, addressing their questions and concerns professionally.
* Maintain organized records of client communications and case-related documentation.
* Assist clients in using the Clio Client Portal and troubleshoot any issues.
* Continuously seek ways to improve the client experience and internal processes.

**Qualifications:*** Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience.
* Sales experience - able to influence and inspire people to work with the firm.
* Previous experience working in immigration law is a must.
* Proficiency in using the Clio case management system is preferred.
* In-depth knowledge of various visa categories, including but not limited to B, E1/E2/E3, H-1B, H3, F1, J-1, L-1, O-1, P1, and employment and marriage-based green card processes.
* Familiarity with the document requirements for each type of immigration case listed above.
* Ability to anticipate what visa types will likely be discussed in a consultation based on the information provided by the prospective client in the initial outreach and draft clarifying questions or request supporting documentation that will be useful to an attorney in the consultation.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with a strong emphasis on empathy and client care.
* Exceptional organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple priorities simultaneously.

**About Company**  

We are a boutique Immigration Law Firm located in the heart of New York City. Our firm is dedicated to providing first-class legal services to our diverse clientele. With a focus on progressiveness and utilizing cutting-edge technology, we strive to exceed expectations and deliver exceptional results.

title: Pilates Manager, New York City
description:
**Company Description** **OUR STORY**


Equinox Group is a high growth collective of the world's most influential, experiential, and differentiated lifestyle brands. We restlessly seek what is next for maximizing life - and boldly grow the lifestyle brands and experiences that define it. In addition to Equinox, our other brands, **Blink, Pure Yoga, SoulCycle, Equinox Hotels and Equinox Media** are all recognized for inspiring and motivating members and employees to maximize life. Our portfolio of brands is recognized globally with locations within every major city across the United States in addition to London, Toronto, and Vancouver.

**OUR CODE**


We are passionate about **high performance living** and we practice what we preach – investing time in our own health and fitness. We believe that everyone has untapped potential within them, and it takes a **disruptive approach** to unleash it. We dream big and don’t settle for the status quo. **We sweat the details**. We never accept less than **110%** to **help each other** deliver the Equinox experience and enable our members to get great results. We are obsessed with what’s new, what’s now, **what’s next**. Never following, always leading, living ahead of the moment in fashion, culture and consumer behavior. We aren’t just a company; we’re a community vested in each other’s success. We value **humility** and a **team approach** at every level of the company.


If you are a high performing individual who is passionate about winning and inspiring others, then we are excited to discuss career opportunities with you.

 **Job Description** **Job Overview**


The Pilates Manager serves as the department’s business leader. This person creates and supports team culture to drive operational excellence and deliver a superior member experience. Pilates Managers are goal-oriented, results-driven, eager to interact with members, and excited to develop and manage a team of high-performing talent. Other duties not listed here may be assigned as necessary to ensure proper department operations.

**Operational Management:**

* Strive to achieve monthly and annual department financial goals
* Ensure the quality delivered through complimentary and paid Pilates services results in continued Pilates engagement
* Attend weekly club management meetings and monthly meetings with Pilates Instructors
* Collaborate with Membership Advisors to offer Pilates business
* Organize and participate in club special events
* Implement and execute all operational SOPs including administrative duties associated with client outreach and staff accountabilities

**Leader of Team Culture:**

* Collaborate with all departments of the club to achieve interdepartmental synergy
* Facilitate team meetings to create a positive team culture and promote continuous growth and development
* Behavior and performance management of Pilates instructors to maintain a high-quality team that upholds the brand standards and expectations of their role
* Build and manage one’s own Pilates business while coaching and supporting the team to do the same
* Active hiring partner and participant in the interview process
* Responsible for providing an excellent candidate experience by efficiently scheduling interviews and making hiring decisions
* Proactively assess and communicate staffing needs to achieve monthly and annual hiring goals
* Lead the operational and sales components of new-hire onboarding

**Learning & Development:**

* Training and developing of new and existing Pilates Instructors to build and maintain their businesses
* Share & promote our Pilates continuing education workshops
* Opportunity to participate in the Equinox Pilates Education Program

  

**Qualifications** **Position Requirements**

* Certified on all Pilates apparatus and/or have completed a Comprehensive Pilates Teacher training program with a minimum of 400 hours
* Aspire to drive a business and achieve financial goals
* Demonstrates professionalism to all employees and members
* Ability to create team accountability through structured timelines and required documentation
* Ability to manage a high volume of inbound communication and respond in a timely manner
* Strong organizational and time management skills
* Verbal and written communication skills
* Demonstrated outgoing and collaborative social skills with a strong desire to interact with members, clients, and staff

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Demonstrated successful leadership ability in an educational, fitness, or management setting
* Previous experience in providing a high caliber of customer service
* Previous sales experience with a specific focus on attracting new clients and retention

**Pay Transparency: $62,400; Plus ability to conduct sessions and earn bonus and commissions**

 **Additional Information**  

* We offer competitive salary, benefits, and industry leading commission opportunities for club employees
* Complimentary Club membership
* Perks and incentives with our products and services including Personal Training, Pilates, Spa and Shop


This job description is intended to describe the general requirements for the position. It is not a complete statement of duties, responsibilities or requirements. Other duties not listed here may be assigned as necessary to ensure the proper operations of the department.


**Equinox is an equal opportunity employer. For more information regarding our career opportunities, please visit one of our clubs or our website at** ***https://careers.equinox.com/***


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Must have a legal right to work in the United States.

title: Registered Nurse, PD ED HMC
description:
Responsible for working with other healthcare professionals to help treat patients with various injuries, illnesses or disabilities. Monitors patients, administers medications, keeps records, consults with healthcare providers, educates patients and more.  

  

  

  

**Principal Accountabilities:**  

  

1. Maintains accurate, complete health care records and reports.
  

2. Administers medications to patients and monitors them for side effects and reactions.
  

3. Prescribes assistive medical devices and related treatments.
  

4. Monitors, reports, and records symptoms or changes in patient conditions.
  

5. Assesses, implements, plans, or evaluates patient nursing care plans by working with healthcare team members.
  

6. Records patient vital signs and medical information.
  

7. Performs other related duties as assigned.


  
Required:


* Graduate of an accredited Nursing program
* Valid NJ RN license
* BLS certification
* ACLS certification
Preferred:


* BSN
* Prior ED or critical care experience

  
ABOUT US


At Atlantic Health System, our promise to our communities is; Anyone who enters one of our facilities, will receive the highest quality care delivered at the right time, at the right place, and at the right cost. This commitment is also echoed in the respect, development and opportunities we give to our more than 20,000 team members. Headquartered in Morristown, New Jersey, we are one of the leading non-profit health care systems in the nation. Our facilities and sites of care include:


* Morristown Medical Center, Morristown, NJ
* Overlook Medical Center, Summit, NJ
* Newton Medical Center, Newton, NJ
* Chilton Medical Center, Pompton Plains, NJ
* Hackettstown Medical Center, Hackettstown, NJ
* Goryeb Children's Hospital, Morristown, NJ
* CentraState Healthcare System, Freehold, NJ
* Atlantic Home Care and Hospice
* Atlantic Mobile Health
* Atlantic Rehabilitation

We also have more than 900 community-based healthcare providers affiliated through Atlantic Medical Group. Atlantic Accountable Care Organization is one of the largest ACOs in the nation, and we are a member of AllSpire Health Partners.


We have received awards and recognition for the services we have provided to our patients, team members and communities. Below are just a few of our accolades:


* 100 Best Companies to Work For ® and FORTUNE® magazine for 15 years
* Best Places to Work in Healthcare - Modern Healthcare
* 150 Top Places to work in Healthcare - Becker's Healthcare
* 100 Accountable Care Organizations to Know - Becker's Hospital Review
* Best Employers for Workers over 50 - AARP
* Gold-Level "Well Workplace": Wellness Council of America (WELCOA)
* One of the 100 Best Workplaces for “Millennials” Great Place to Work® and FORTUNE® magazine
* One of the 20 Best Workplaces in Health Care: Great Place to Work® and FORTUNE® magazine
* Official Health Care Partner of the New York Jets
* NJ Sustainable Business
Hackettstown Medical Center has been providing care to the community since 1973, primarily serving Warren, Sussex and Morris Counties in New Jersey. From preventive services and outpatient testing, to care for minor injuries and life-threatening illness, we offer a wide range of services to keep our local population healthy. Hackettstown Medical Center maintains several designations, including Primary Stroke Center from both the New Jersey Department of Health & Senior Services and The Joint Commission’s advanced certification program; accreditations from the American College of Radiology for mammography, nuclear medicine and ultrasound; sleep disorder center accreditation from the American Academy of Sleep Medicine; and Quality of Care recognition for our cardiopulmonary department from the American Association for Respiratory Care. In addition, we provide education, screenings, support groups and wellness programs for people of all ages through our Center for Healthier Living.  

  

EEO STATEMENT  

  

Atlantic Health System, Inc. is an equal employment opportunity employer and federal contractor or subcontractor and therefore abides by applicable laws to protect applicants and employees from discrimination in hiring, promotion, discharge, pay, fringe benefits, job training, classification, referral, and other aspects of employment, on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity and sexual orientation), national origin, citizenship status, disability, age, genetics, or veteran status.

title: Dietitian - Per Diem IP
description:
Responsible for monitoring the AHS's compliance in accordance with current applicable Federal, State and local dietary standards, guidelines, and regulations. Ensures that the highest degree of quality resident care is maintained at all times.  

  

  

  

**Principal Accountabilities:**  

  

1. Provides clinical nutrition assessment and documentation for general medical and surgical oncology, bariatric/weight management and critical care.
  

2. Maintains quality assurance and evaluates compliance with corporate policies and procedures and State and Federal guidelines.
  

3. Assists in planning, developing, organizing, implementing and evaluating the Dietary Department, its programs and activities.
  

4. Assists dietary staff in use of departmental policies and procedures.
  

5. Provides written/oral reports to the Administrator or required concerning the operations of the Dietary Department.
  

6. Manages and improves policies, procedures, and programs to assure compliance with regulatory requirements by making oral/written recommendations to the Corporate Dietitian.
  

7. Develops and participates in educational sessions for staff to increase knowledge of staff and improve resident care for the Dietary Department.
  

8. Reviews appropriate web sites, publications and other educational materials to ensure that the standards of practice are being achieved.
  

9. Monitors food temperature and taste through the use of Test Trays, Meal Evaluations and review of Food Temperature Logs.
  

10. Performs other related duties as assigned.


  
Required:
  

1. Bachelor's degree in Nutrition and Dietetics, Home Science or related field.
  

2. Licensed with the State of New Jersey as a Registered Dietetic Technician or Registered Dietician or Dietary Manager Association or as applicable.
  

  

Preferred:
  

1. Master's degree in Nutrition and Dietetics, Home Science or related field.
  

2. 2-3 year's experience in acute care clinical nutrition or relevant area.

title: Field Project Coordinator
description:
At All Season Global Solutions, we combine construction, warehousing, and moving services to provide our clients with a full-service project solution. As a rapidly expanding company in the construction and relocation sectors, we are seeking driven individuals eager to thrive and advance within our organization. We work for some of the most prestigious clients in corporate real estate and hospitality sectors. We are a NJ based company providing service mainly in the NYC and NJ area.

We are seeking a Field Operations Supervisor/Project Manager ***with experience in the Commercial Relocations and Moving industry***. We are looking to hire a hard-working field supervisor to manage the day-to-day field operations of the assigned work team. This position will be responsible for overseeing the relocation, delivery and logistics of materials. If you are a detail-oriented individual with a strong understanding of logistics and enjoy working in a collaborative team environment, we encourage you to apply!

**Responsibilities:**

* Managing large commercial relocation projects.
* Overseeing crews of 5-20 Supervisors, Laborers, Drivers, and Installers.
* Coordination between internal partners such as salesmen, operations, and warehouse as well as external partners including clients and end-users.
* Daily reporting and project planning.
* Management of equipment and resources on relocations projects.
* Providing leadership to on-site staff, sub-contractors, and other parties.
* Acting as the main point of communication between the main field and the office.
* Handling additional duties to support crews on project site as needed.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Qualifications:**

* Professional presentation and demeanor A MUST
* Experience with efficiently managing field teams of 5-20 people.
* The ability to work in different environmental conditions
* Experience with planning and logistics in the moving/relocations industry.
* Must possess excellent communication skills.
* Ability to meet strict deadlines.
* Computer literacy to include Microsoft Office applications.
* Must possess a valid driver’s license.
* Must possess strong organizational, efficient, and detail-oriented skill sets.

**Why join us?**

* Growth Opportunities: We believe in nurturing talent and offering career development pathways for our team members.
* Collaborative Environment: You’ll work with a supportive team that values creativity and innovation

All Season Global Solutions, is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in its hiring process with applicants, whether internal or external, because of race, creed, color, age, national origin, ancestry, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, genetic information, veteran status, military status, application for military service or any other class per local, state or federal law.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $26.00 - $28.00 per hour

Expected hours: 35 – 40 per week

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 10 hour shift
* 8 hour shift
* Weekends as needed

Experience:

* Project management: 1 year (Preferred)

Ability to Commute:

* Kearny, NJ (Required)

Willingness to travel:

* 100% (Required)

Work Location: On the road

title: Dietetic Assistant - Per Diem
description:
Atlantic Health System is seeking a Per Diem Dietetic Assistant for the Food Service Department at Newton Medical Center to work varied hours, including every other weekend.


**Essential Function/Responsibilities:**

* Collects and assembles appropriate menus for assigned floors based on diet order. Menu is consistent with orders in Care Manager system. (b) Completes menu selections with patients. (c) Communicates with the nurses on the assigned units for patient requests/late trays//supplies.
* Documents delivery of late trays/new orders to monitor food costs. (e). Communicates questions with Registered Dietitians.
* Maintains friendly and efficient attitude towards customers, co-workers and clients. Maintains standards of the department and those set by the Hospital, the Department of Health and JCAHO. Orients patients to Policies and Procedures. Assesses patients acceptance and tolerance of food during meals and overall satisfaction with the service. Communicates necessary information to Dietitians and Clinical Nutrition Coordinator including any patients deemed to be at nutritional risk for difficulty with oral intake or diet consistency. Accurately compiles a list of special food orders and communicates effectively with food production employees.
* Delivers trays to patients in a timely fashion. Identifies patient using patient identifiers. Verifies NPO lists with units. Assists with tray set-up as requested.
* Prepares cold food items per specifications to recipies, are appealing and properly labeled. Delivers food stock/supplies to assigned units and stocks supplies to par levels. Records supplies delievered daily to monitor food costs.
* Attends all in-services and training programs as directed and applies the knowledge to improve work performance. Assists in mentoring and training new employees as leadership skill development process Adheres to all established systems and training programs to provide a safe environment for self, coworkers, visitors and other staff in the institution. Reports unsafe conditions such as damaged equipment, unsafe and unsanitary conditions to supervisors and management. Complies with all OSHA regulations and other local, state and federal regulations. Maintains compliance with all requirements of Federal, State and local regulations and guidelines including the Civil Rights Act of 1964, as amended, the Age Discrimination in Employment Act of 1967, as amended, and the Americans with Disabilities Act, as amended.
* Consistently cleans during shift, following cleaning schedule and clean as you go. Has been trained in the proper use of all cleaning chemicals and location and usage of MSDS sheets.

  
**Minimum Education:**

* High School Diploma or GED equivalent required

**Minimum Experience:**

* Previous food service experience preferred
* To provide a safe environment to our patients, we require that all candidates must be able to read, write and speak English
* Must be able to lift, push, pull 50 lbs

title: Materials Rep
description:
Responsible for providing logistical support to the designated department through routine supply replenishment workflows. Primarily focuses on the daily receiving, breakdown, distribution and stocking of generic supplies.  

  

  

  

**Principal Accountabilities:**  

  

1. Performs manual and clerical duties related to shipping, receiving, inspecting, storing, issuing and delivering a variety of materials, equipment and supplies.
  

2. Counts, weighs or measures incoming or outgoing items to compare identifying information and variety against bills of lading, invoices, orders or other records.
  

3. Examines incoming shipments for damage or shortages and corresponds with shipper to rectify.
  

4. Completes paperwork or forms required for documentation.
  

5. Determines method of shipment utilizing knowledge of shipping procedures, routes and rates.
  

6. Prepares materials for shipping by weighing, packaging and stamping. Prepares necessary shipping forms such as bills of lading.
  

7. Operates material handling equipment such as forklifts, pallet jacks, hand trucks or dollies to move stock or reorganize storage.
  

8. Performs work under direct supervision and handles basic issues and problems, and refers more complex issues to higher-level staff.
  

9. Performs other related duties as assigned.


  
Required:
  

1. High School Diploma or equivalent.
  

2. 1 year of experience working in Material Handling or relevant area.
  

  

Preferred:
  

1. Bachelor's degree in Logistics or relevant area.

description:
1. Assists patients with activities of daily living including bathing, feeding, dressing
  

2. Obtains and records vital signs, weights, and heights
  

3. Assists patients with mobility: ambulation, transfer, discharges and ROM activities
  

4. Performs post mortem care
  

5. Performs EKG's, phlebotomy and blood glucose monitoring
  

6. Observes and reports changes in patients' condition to the RN
  

7. Maintains phlebotomy equipment and inventory
  

8. Other related duties as assigned.


  
Required:
  

1. HS Diploma or equivalent
  

2. EMT certification and/or nursing assistant certification
  

  

Preferred:
  

1. Strong interpersonal communication skills, both verbal and written
  

2. Patient, compassionate nature
  

3. Ability to operate as part of a team, alongside physicians and nurses
  

4. Proficiency in computer-based data management programs and information systems


  
Atlantic Medical Group is a physician-led and physician-governed organization that delivers the highest quality health care, at the right place, the right price, and the right time. We are a multispecialty physician group with more than 1,000 doctors, nurse practitioners and physician assistants at over 300 locations throughout northern and central New Jersey and northeast Pennsylvania. Our mission is to deliver exceptional care recognizing the unique needs of all those we serve. Our vision is to achieve the best outcomes with our patients at the center of the physician-led team, driven by service, innovation and continuous learning.


Our integrated network offers seamless access to Atlantic Health System’s entire health care continuum and our nationally and regionally ranked hospitals. In collaboration with Atlantic Health System, several of our practices offer urgent care and walk-in services.


In addition to primary care physicians, the team includes specialists that care for patients in all aspects of their health from pediatrics to geriatrics and everything in between. We make health decisions easier for patients with enhanced access to referrals.

title: Assistant General Manager Wanted
description:
**Rosa Mexicano Restaurants**, a NYC based, successful casual fine dining restaurant group known for outstanding hospitality and service and for offering an authentic menu that the Zagat Survey calls, "the 'gold standard' of 'upscale modern' Mexican cuisine", with locations in New York, New Jersey, Massachusetts, Pennsylvania, Las Vegas, and Maryland, seeks an **ASSISTANT GENERAL MANAGER for our Hackensack location.**

**Key Responsibilities:**


* Oversees P&L and budgeting as it pertains to the account
* Manages overall day to day operations of the account
* Conducts HR functions including hiring, progressive counseling, terminations
* Oversees scheduling, payroll, and team training
* Maintains excellent relationships with customers, guests and Client as well as other departments
* Works with the Chef and management team in creating menus and providing top quality food
* Rolls out new culinary programs in conjunction with Company marketing and culinary team
* Hires, trains, and develops all FOH restaurant staff in fine dining service standards
* Maintains schedules, payroll, and other administrative support to maintain food and beverage cost controls
* including inventory and pars
* Organizes and conducts pre-shift and departmental meetings daily
* Maintains communication with all departments to ensure customer service needs are met
* Creates seating charts and station assignments daily, following up with support staff of daily expected business
* Maintains all reservation systems and books to accommodate business demands
* Creates side work assignments and ensures completion with wait staff
* Maintains the highest level of service to client/guest, ensuring their satisfaction
* Maintains cleanliness and presentation of dining room area
* Investigates and resolves all client/guest complaints in a timely, professional, diplomatic manner

**Experience Includes:**


* 5-8 years of upscale restaurant experience in a management position
* Food Handler certified
* Knowledgeable with Labor Laws, Health Codes, Safety, Food Handling, and Sanitation
* High volume production and catering experience is essential
* Previous experience managing a budget
* Must be able to work a flexible schedule including days, nights, weekends, and holidays

Rosa Mexicano provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws

title: Registered Nurse, PD Parent Education OMC
description:
Responsible for working with other healthcare professionals to help treat patients with various injuries, illnesses or disabilities. Monitors patients, administers medications, keeps records, consults with healthcare providers, educates patients and more.


***Essential Job Functions:***

*The selected candidate will provide Lactation Consultation services to new moms and infants postpartum in the hospital and assist with outpatient consults.*

*The candidate will also facilitate breastfeeding support group and teach breastfeeding classes prenatally.* 

*Candidate will have the ability to utilize the nursing process to assess, diagnose, plan, implement and evaluate the plan of care for patients served.*

*Through the model of Shared Governance, collaborate with all members of the health care team with a focus on promoting evidenced based care within a healing culture for the patient population served and their families.*

*Candidate will demonstrate and embrace the PRIDE core values (Purpose, Respect, Innovation, Diversity & Inclusion and Extraordinary Caring ) in every aspect of their job.*

*Candidate must have excellent communication and computer skills.*  

  

  

**Principal Accountabilities:**  

  

1. Maintains accurate, complete health care records and reports.
  

2. Monitors, reports, and records symptoms or changes in patient conditions.
  

3. Assesses, implements, plans, or evaluates patient nursing care plans by working with healthcare team members.
  

4. Records medical information.
  

5. Performs other related duties as assigned.


  
Required:
  

1. Bachelor degree in Nursing or related field or enrolled in a BSN program.
  

2. 2-3+ years of experience in Nursing or relevant area.
  

3. Current state licensure as a Registered Nurse and BLS certification required.
  

4. IBCLC certification and/or LCCE.
  

  

Preferred:
  

1. Masters degree in Nursing or related field.


2. Previous experience with teaching childbirth classes and prenatal education.


3. Previous experience with lactation consulting.
